review: Loving the AFTV so far!  Dropped our cable subscription down to internet and basic cable channels only and honestly have not missed all the extra cable channels we had now that we have this little box in the living room!  Not to mention I'm saving $100+ now because of it!My only gripe is as others have mentioned...Hulu Plus does not want to run all that well on AFTV.  Video will often freeze while the audio continues to play.  We are lucky to have our smart tv hardwired to our modem so we just stream Hulu through the smart tv and everything else through the AFTV.  Still a 5 star product for us as the Hulu issue appears to be with the app on the Android platform as users of Roku and other boxes have the same problems with it.  Hopefully, a fix will be put out by Hulu soon!
author: T. Miller

review: I am on my second Fire TV. First one had to be returned for sound issues and shuttering while watching sports. The second unit does not have sound issues but still shutters during sporting events. It is very annoying. I have compared the unit to my Apple TV, which is a couple yrs old. Plugged both units into CAT 5 cable and compared over WiFi. The Apple TV has very limited to no shuttering, while the Amazon Fire TV shutters like crazy. I have watched sporting events on SlingTV and Watch ESPN.Second issue is with having to sign into Watch ESPN every day. This is diffenently  not the way to watch sports.If you subscribe to Sling TV. You only have two options for media players, Amazon Fire TV or Roku 3. If I had to do it over again, I would have gone with the Roku 3. If Apple gets Sling TV, I will diffenently go with Apple TV.I am considering replacing the Amazon TV for a 3rd time.Note: I have an Internet speed of 30 Mbps.
